intro: Stenopetalum gracile, commonly known as the slender-leafed stenopetalum, is a small shrub native to the tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas. Stenopetalum gracile is adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions, making it a hardy species in its native habitat.
